transcripts.text: Well, that presupposes that there are only two options, that he was talking to the real Samuel or to a demon.  We don't know the answer to that question.  All we do know clearly from the Scripture itself is that what was being done there was absolutely forbidden by God because it was an example of the act of necromancy, of trying to communicate with the dead.  Now, whether the Witch of Endor was a magician in terms of some of those people who do seances today and imitate the voices and the figures of those who have passed on, whether it was a demon doing a false work that the devil does lying signs and wonder, or whether it was actually Samuel that was called up from the dead in opposition to the explicit prohibition of God.  We don't know the answer.
